CatDescriptText: Mrs. Bessie Lyman, Homewood and Mr. Carl Watkins, Homewood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 7, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Admitting many factors cause juvenile delinquency, which one do you think is the major contributor to this increasing social illness?" Mrs. Bessie Lyman's answer reads: "The parents are the chief cause.  The home environment is the cause.  Religion, more religion, should be in the home.  The parents should really train the child by ruling their homes..."  Mr. Carl Watkins' answer reads: "A lot of things.  The youngsters do as they please and do not have anybody to answer to.  Also, they have no place to go."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Bessie Lyman wearing dark coat with fur collar and cuffs and hat with bow, standing in front of brick wall; Portrait of Carl Watkins wearing varsity style jacket, eyeglasses, and knit cap with dark stripe, standing in front of building and pole
